articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Olena Harmash
articles.description: Ukraine used U.S. ATACMS missiles to strike Russian territory for the first time, Moscow said, in a major escalation on the war's 1,000th day.
articles.title: Ukraine hits Russia with US missiles for first time on war's 1,000th day

articles.author: Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Intensifying efforts for a truce in Lebanon have brought into focus the role of the country's army, which would be expected to keep the south free of Hezbollah weapons but is neither willing nor able to confront the Iran-backed group, seven sources said.
articles.title: As truce talks progress, Lebanon's army cornered by politics, funding

articles.author: James Pomfret, Jessie Pang
articles.description: Hong Kong pro-democracy tycoon Jimmy Lai on Wednesday testified in court for the first time in his years-long national security legal battle on charges of conspiracy to collude with foreign forces, and publishing seditious materials.
articles.title: Hong Kong pro-democracy tycoon Lai testifies in national security trial

articles.author: Joey Roulette
articles.description: Elon Musk's SpaceX launched its sixth Starship test flight to space on Tuesday from Texas, eyeing an array of improvements on the rocket as U.S. President-elect Donald Trump watched in person.
articles.title: Trump, Musk watch SpaceX's Starship lift off from Texas

articles.author: Andreas Rinke, Sarah Marsh
articles.description: Pressure is piling on Germany's unpopular Chancellor Olaf Scholz to let someone else lead his Social Democrats into the upcoming snap election to give the party now languishing in third place in polls a better shot of catching up.
articles.title: Pressure grows on Germany's Scholz over bid for second term

articles.author: Lidia Kelly
articles.description: A special hotline in place to deflate crises between the Kremlin and the White House is not currently being used, the Kremlin said on Wednesday, as nuclear risks rise amid the highest tensions between Russia and West in decades.
articles.title: Kremlin says Russia-US hotline to deflate crisis not in use

articles.author: Ralph Tedy Erol, Harold Isaac
articles.description: More than two dozen suspected gang members were killed in Haiti's capital on Tuesday after residents joined police to fight off an attempted overnight attack on an affluent hillside suburb of Port-au-Prince, police said.
articles.title: More than two dozen killed after attempted attack on Haiti suburb

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Filipina spared from execution on drug trafficking charges in Indonesia in 2015 will be transferred to the Philippines after years of negotiations between the two Southeast Asian neighbours, President Ferdinand Marcos Jr said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Philippines to repatriate Filipina drug convict from Indonesia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Joe Biden has approved providing anti-personnel land mines to Ukraine, a U.S. official told Reuters.
articles.title: Biden approves anti-personnel mines for Ukraine, US official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Around 10,900 North Korean troops have been deployed to Kursk as part of Russia's airborne unit and marines, with some already participating in battles in the Ukraine war, a South Korean lawmaker said on Wednesday citing the country's spy agency.
articles.title: North Korea troops have joined Ukraine war battles as part of Russian units, Seoul says
